title: Image
description: This element describes the actual image that was acquired and its meta-data. The elements that are references (ending in Ref or Settings) refer to elements defined outside of the Image element. Ref elements are simple links, while Settings elements are links with additional values. If any of the required Image attributes or elements are missing, its guaranteed to be an invalid document.

subCategoriesOrder.Image: This element describes the actual image that was acquired and its meta-data. The elements that are references (ending in Ref or Settings) refer to elements defined outside of the Image element. Ref elements are simple links, while Settings elements are links with additional values. If any of the required Image attributes or elements are missing, its guaranteed to be an invalid document.
subCategoriesOrder.Instrument: This empty element refers to the Instrument that was utilized to acquire this image.
subCategoriesOrder.Experiment: This empty element refers to the Experiment during which this Image was acquired.
subCategoriesOrder.Experimenter: This empty element refers to Experimenter that performed this experiment.
subCategoriesOrder.ExperimenterGroup: This empty element refers to the ExperimenterGroup that owns this Image.
subCategoriesOrder.TIRFSettings: Defines the TIRF settings used for this experiment.
subCategoriesOrder.ImagingEnvironment: This describes the environment in which the biological sample was kept during the acquisition of this image.
subCategoriesOrder.MicroscopeSettings: This element refers to the microscope used to acquire this image and it holds the settings that were applied to the microscope during this acquisition.
subCategoriesOrder.ObjectiveSettings: This element refers to the objective used to acquire this image and it holds the settings that were applied to the objective during this acquisition.
subCategoriesOrder.OpticalCalibration: This describes the procedure that was used for optical calibration and the resulting calibration measurements.
subCategoriesOrder.DetectorCalibration: This procedure measures the performance of the dectector.
subCategoriesOrder.Plane: Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Plane element holds microscope stage and image timing data for a given channel/z-section/timepoint. The total number of Plane elements for a given Image must equal to SizeZ x SizeC x SizeT.
subCategoriesOrder.Channel: Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Channel element stores information about how the each image channel was acquired. The total number of Channel elements for a given Image must equal to SizeC.
subCategoriesOrder.BinData: The contents of this element are base64-encoded.  These are not CDATA sections just a base64 stream.
subCategoriesOrder.TiffData: This describes the location of the pixel data in a tiff file.

Name.description: A user assigned name for this Image.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this Image.

AcquisitionDate.description: The acquisition date of the Image.

SizeX.description: X size of the pixel data array.

SizeZ.description: Dimensional size of pixel data array.

SizeC.description: Dimensional size of pixel data array.

SizeT.description: Dimensional size of pixel data array.

PhysicalSizeX.description: Physical width of a pixel expressed in µm.

PhysicalSizeY.description: Physical height of a pixel expressed in µm.

TimeIncrement.description: This attribute is used for time series that have a global timing specification instead of per-timepoint timing info. For example in a video stream.

DimensionOrder.description: The order in which the individual planes of data are interleaved.

ChannelOrder.description: The order in which the channels were acquired and are stored.

PixelType.description: The variable type used to represent each pixel in the Image.

SignificantBits.description: The number of bits within the type storing each pixel that are significant. e.g. you can store 12 bit data within a 16 bit type. This does not reduce the storage requirements but can be a useful indicator when processing or viewing the image data.

Interleaved.description: How the channels are arranged within the data block: true if channels are stored RGBRGBRGB...; false if channels are stored RRR...GGG...BBB...

BigEndian.description: This is true if the pixels data was written in BigEndian order. If this value is present it should match the value used in BinData or TiffData. If it does not a reader should honour the value used in the BinData or TiffData. This values is useful for MetadataOnly files and is to allow for future storage solutions.

TIRFSettings.description: Defines the TIRF settings used for this experiment.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

ThroughLens.description: The TIRF modality used in this case. True=Through the lens TIRF modality. False=TIRF modality in which the laser light is not travelling through the objective lens.

TIRFAngle.description: The incidence angle used in this case

Geometry.description: The TIRF geometry used in this case

ImagingEnvironment.description: This describes the environment in which the biological sample was kept, during the acquisition of this image.

Temperature.description: The Temperature at which the imaging experiment was conducted

Humidity.description: Humidity around the sample [units:none]. A fraction, as a value from 0.0 to 1.0.

CO2Percent.description: Carbon Dioxide concentration around the sample [units:none]. A fraction, as a value from 0.0 to 1.0

MicroscopeSettings.description: This element refers to the microscope used to acquire this image and it holds the settings that were applied to the microscope during this acquisition.

ID.description: This is the unique identifier of the microscope used in this case.

FieldOfView.description: The Field of View defines the area of the specimen that is viewable via the eyepiece. This field caputers the measures size of the Field of View.

TotalEffectiveMagnification.description: This is the total effective magnification used in this case. This number can be obtained by multiplying Optovar/Magnification times the Objective/NominalMagnification or even better the Objective/CalibratedMagnification if available.

ObjectiveSettings.description: This element refers to the objective used to acquire this image and it holds the settings that were applied to the objective during this acquisition.

ID.description: This is the unique identifier of the objective used in this case.

CorrectionCollar.description: When using high numerical aperture dry objectives (numerical aperture of 0.8 or greater), cover glass thickness variations of only a few micrometers result in dramatic image degradation due to aberration, which grows worse with increasing cover glass thickness. To compensate for this error, the more highly corrected objectives are equipped with a correction collar to allow adjustment of the central lens group position to coincide with fluctuations in cover glass thickness. The CorrectionCollar is normally an adjustable ring on the objective, whose position can be modified. This field records the position of the collar during the acquisition of this image. Each correction collar has an arbitrary scale on it so the values is unit-less.

ImmersionMedium.description: The actual immersion medium that was used for the acquisition of this image.

ImmersionRefractiveIndex.description: The nominal refractive index of the immersion medium utilized in this case, as specified by the manufacturer.

MeasuredRefractiveIndex.description: The temperature dependenent measured Refractive Index of ther immersion medium utilized in this case.

Temperature.description: The temperature of the objective if different from the ImagingEnvironment/Temperature.

OpticalCalibration.description: This describes the procedure that was used for optical calibration and the resulting calibration measurements.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Date.description: The date in which this calibration was performed.

MedianSpotSize_FWHM.description: Observed median lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile. This is a measure of the observed resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

MedianTheoretical_FWHM.description: Theoretical (expected) medians lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile, on the basis of the given optical conditions. This is a measure of the expected resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

MinSpotSize_FWHM.description: Observed minimum lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile. This is a measure of the observed resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

MinTheoretical_FWHM.description: Theoretical (expected) minimum lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile, on the basis of the given optical conditions. This is a measure of the expected resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

MinTheoretical_FWHMUnit.description: Theoretical (expected) minimum lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile, on the basis of the given optical conditions. This is a measure of the expected resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

MaxSpotSize_FWHM.description: Observed maximum lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile. This is a measure of the observed resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

MaxTheoretical_FWHM.description: Theoretical (expected) maximum lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile, on the basis of the given optical conditions. This is a measure of the expected resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

MaxTheoretical_FWHMUnit.description: Theoretical (expected) maximum lateral spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile, on the basis of the given optical conditions. This is a measure of the expected resolution of the system in the xy-plane.

ZSpotSize_FWHM.description: Observed z-axial spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile. This is a measure of the observed resolution of the system in the z-plane.

ZSpotSize_FWHMUnit.description: Observed z-axial spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile. This is a measure of the observed resolution of the system in the z-plane.

FWHM_ZTheoretical.description: Theoretical (expected) z-axial spot size expressed as the Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the fitted Point Spread Function (PSF) intensity profile, on the basis of the given optical conditions. This is a measure of the expected resolution of the system in the z-plane.

Planarity.description: This is a measure of the flatness of the focal plane across the Field of View (FOV). The planarity of the focal plane is calculated from the observed z-position of the best focus of each spot. It indicates focal aberrations or tilt.

Asymmetry.description: This field reports the mean +/- standard deviation over the Field of View (FOV) of the observed Point Spread Function (PSF) Asymmetry (i.e. the ratio of the minimum lateral FWMH over the maximum lateral FWHM). It indicates the presence of optical aberrations.

LateralChromaticShift.description: The lateral offset of the observed spot position between two color channels.

AxialChromaticShift.description: The axial offset of the observed spot position between two color channels.

DetectorCalibration.description: This procedure measures the performance of the dectector.

Method.description: This is a description of method used for this calibration procedure.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Date.description: The date in which this calibration procedure was performed.

Plane.description: Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Plane element holds microscope stage and image timing data for a given channel/z-section/timepoint. The total number of Plane elements for a given Image must equal to SizeZ x SizeC x SizeT.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this Plane.

TheZ.description: The Z-section to which this plane corresponds. This is numbered from 0

TheT.description: The timepoint to which this plane corresponds. This is numbered from 0

TheC.description: The channel to which this plane corresponds. This is numbered from 0

Timestamp.description: This records the total time intercoursed since the beginning of image acquisitoin.

ExposureTime.description: The length of the exposure utilized to acquire this plane.

Channel.description: Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Channel element stores information about how the each image channel was acquired. The total number of Channel elements for a given Image must equal to SizeC.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this Channel.

Name.description: A name for the channel that is suitable for presentation to the user.

SamplesPerPixel.description: The number of samples the detector takes to form each pixel value. [units:none] Note: This is not the same as 'Frame Averaging' - see Integration in DetectorSettings.

IlluminationType.description: The method of illumination used to capture the channel.

PinholeSize.description: The optional PinholeSize attribute allows specifying adjustable pin-hole diameters for confocal microscopes.

AcquisitionMode.description: AcquisitionMode describes the type of microscopy performed for each channel.

ContrastMethod.description: ContrastMethod describes the technique used to achieve contrast for each channel.

ExcitationWavelength.description: The excitation wavelength used for this channel.

EmissionWavelength.description: The emission wavelength used for this channel.

Fluorophore.description: This is the name of the fluorophore used to produce this channel [plain text string].

NDFilter.description: The NDfilter attribute is used to specify the combined effect of any neutral density filters used. The amount of light the filter transmits at a maximum. A fraction, as a value from 0.0 to 1.0. NOTE: This was formerly described as 'units optical density expressed as a PercentFraction'. This was how the field had been described in the schema from the beginning but all the use of it has been in the opposite direction, i.e. as a amount transmitted, not the amount blocked. This change has been made to make the model reflect this usage.

PockelCellSetting.description: The PockelCellSetting used for this channel. This is the amount the polarization of the beam is rotated by

Color.description: A color used to render this channel - encoded as RGBA. The default value '-1' is #FFFFFFFF so solid white (it is a signed 32 bit value). NOTE: Prior to the 2012-06 schema the default value was incorrect and produced a transparent red not solid white.

BinData.description: The contents of this element are base64-encoded.  These are not CDATA sections, just a base64 stream.

TiffData.description: This describes the location of the pixel data in a tiff file.

MetadataOnly.description: This place holder means there is on pixel data in this file.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is a simple multi-line comment or annotation describing this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
